reviews.text: An ultra-modern hotel sheltering behind a somewhat authoritarian Victorian facade and located within extensive grounds. Although the area (The Crighton) is styled as a business park don't be misled; it's a quiet wooded backwater of Dumfries but only a mile or so from the centre of town. Well appointed and comfortable bedrooms. Fully disabled accessible throughout the hotel. Great little brasserie - one of the few hotel restaurants I would choose to eat in rather than eat out. Excellent breakfast selection and super quality - service personally supervised by the duty chef. Plenty of parking and, most importantly, the most pleasant and helpful staff you could hope to find.
reviews.title: If only every hotel was as good as the Aston

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although we booked this break just the night before we went we really couldn't have chosen a better hotel.
reviews.title: Couldn't fault it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there over the Easter weekend and were inpressed both with the service and the cleanliness. First impressions are very important and this hotel passed the test with flying colours. The check in staff were helpful and courteous, the room was spacious and spotlessly clean and the hotel had a very relaxed feel about it. The location of the hotel is delightful, being in a quiet area just a short walk or drive from the centre of Dumfries. This meant that there was no traffic noise or rowdiness from revellers when the pubs closed.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay.

reviews.text: I would reccommend the Aston to anyone wanting a break in Dumfries and we would certainly go back if we visit the area again.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in superb setting, especially for a wedding at the Crichton

reviews.text: A very smart and welcoming hotel when we first entered reception in the old part of the building. The room, which was situated in a new block adjesent to the main building, was very comfortable, had a telly with freeview, a nice smart bathroom with toilet and shower, and a hugh soft bed. The breakfast was good, but not great. Thou dinner was very good. We ate two nights there and was not disappointed with the service or the quality of food. The location of the hotel was situated in the beautiful grounds of the university and was a bus ride or 5min drive from the centre of town. Overall all a very pleasant stay.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.text: Stayed at the Aston with many friends and family for the recent wedding of our eldest son. The hotel staff are very pleasant and helpful. We did have a problem with a sewerage smell in our original bedroom (201 I believe) and were moved the following day (wedding daym so a bit stressful) to a smell free room.
reviews.title: Beautiful Wedding Venue

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Aston Hotel shares beautiful grounds with the Crichton Church and Easterbrook Hall which are regularly used for weddings. The hotel itself is very comfortable and rooms look exactly as described on their website. Ideal location to be close to everything needed for the wedding, which went off very well. Only hiccough we had was with the company who arranged the wedding, but the hotel and hall did everything promised of them to make everything special for the wedding party. Would also recommend Casa Mia restaurant in Dumfries, where we had a fantastic family dinner the evening before the wedding - again, food superb and staff excellent.
reviews.title: Good value hotel in interesting location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is part of an estate that once formed a psychiatric hospital. There are extensive grounds including an arboretum and beautiful rock garden.
reviews.title: Hit -or- Miss, potential for good & bad stay...

reviews.text: We stayed just one night as a break on our way north. It was very convenient - about 25 miles west of Gretna Green; and gave us an opportunity the following morning to stretch our legs walking round a lovely RSPB Nature Reserve on the Solway Firth coast.
reviews.title: Reasonably Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was in the new wing and was very comfortable. The main building is quite historic, whilst the bar and restaurant are very tastefully decorated in a modern style that blends well with the period building. Dinner and breakfast were both excellent. Will definitely stay here again when we are in the area.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: Here with a small group. We were given a private room for both dinners and one of our breakfasts, the wedding party rightly getting it on the second breakfast. Excellent service; we had a limited-choice menu with simple food cooked imaginatively, though let down by poor house wine. Breakfast service in the main dining room on Sunday was slow for the toast and coffee that's brought to the table, but the breakfast buffet was all you'd need, including fresh fruit.
reviews.title: good for groups

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern extension to an old building has been well handled. Bedroom spacious; power shower but I must admit I prefer the option of a bath. Comfy bed. Curtains well lined so no light came in. Quiet road nearby at weekends, might be noisier during the week as the Crichton Estate houses a college and a business park. Hotel doesn't allow dogs, but ours stayed in the car and loved the big lawns of the estate (and there are poo bins). I'm told the bus links into town are good. Nearby Caerlaverock Castle and the wetland reserve are both worth visiting, to see the countryside so close to the hotel, and to enjoy the views to the Lake District or to Criffel, the domed hill that is the local landmark.
reviews.title: rooms are great

reviews.text: There is air con in the bedrooms. The tilting window for fresh air is only held by one strut. This opening window frame fell into the room of another couple in our group and onto the chairs where they'd been sitting. Luckily they were out at the time, and management did offer them another room without hesitation, but they were quite shocked which put a bit of a downer on the evening.
reviews.title: Good for |Business

reviews.text: went here for a wedding in feb 2010, got ther and was upgraded to the executive room- bonus at no extra charge.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.text: room was brill, really big with a bath and shower. bed was HUGE!!!!
reviews.title: Brilliant - New Year

reviews.text: Altogether an unpleasant experience. Grubby curtains, broken mirror and light bulb in my room. Inexperienced reception staff overseen by discourteous and incompetent managers. A very poor breakfast: industrial bread, jam and butter all encased in plastic. This hotel is really letting Scotland down.
reviews.title: Could do a lot better...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent the weekend at the hotel with my parents. I was on crutches after just breaking my ankle and my parents both have disabilities. We were accomodated in ground floor rooms to make things easier. The staff were very helpful collecting my parents bags from the car and taking them to the room. Everyone was very friendly, smiling and helpful.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel within beautiful grounds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was very clean. the rooms were bright and had power showers with the added bonus of a fitted bench to sit down if required. The only thing we missed was a fridge/ mini bar. Dispite this the bar prices were very reasonable. The food in the restaurent was very good. There was a good choice and a change daily to the specials menu. On the first night we found the service to be a bit slow but we were not in any hurry so it didn't really matter. Breakfast was buffet style with excellent choices and the option to order something if nothing suited. Overall very enjoyable stay.
reviews.title: Superb hotel with immaculately clean rooms and friendly and helpful staff

reviews.text: We have just returned from 2 nights at the Aston Hotel, where we booked a Rambler's Break with Hotelshop. We were not sure what to expect as we paid a bargain price but we were very pleasantly surprised by the quality of the hotel - I can't understand why it has a 3-star rating - I'm sure it should be 4! Although we reserved a standard double room, it was large and luxurious with a king size bed and contemporary quality furnishings, and there was nothing to fault. The breakfast had ample choice and immediate attentive service from the politest staff we have encountered, and it was the same at dinner, where on on our first night, our orders were taken and food served to us very quickly, despite the kitchen being busy with two weddings and other functions -we might have expected to be neglected a little, but not so. We were also given delicious freshly-made packed lunches, which were gratefully consumed atop Criffel after a challenging ascent through what felt like miles of bog! I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this as a great place for a short break, with excellent staff and stunning countryside near at hand.
reviews.title: So Good We're Going Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Aston in August for our wedding anniversary, rooms were lovely everything spotless, I am a wheelchair user and had no problems as the hotel
